subject: Programming
title: PageRank and the Google Revolution
description: A micro-lesson that makes PageRank and the Google Revolution usable.

hook.text: In 1998, two Stanford students turned a graph algorithm into the world's most valuable company.

buildup.text: Larry Page and Sergey Brin modeled the web as a graph, where links between pages were edges.

discovery.text: PageRank scored pages by how many other important pages linked to them. Quality over quantity.

twist.text: Spammers gamed it with link farms. Google had to keep evolving the algorithm to stay ahead.

climax.text: A graph algorithm that ranked web pages created a trillion-dollar company.

punchline.text: One algorithm organized the entire internet.

quiz.question: What does PageRank measure?
options: How many important pages link to a page
How many words a page contains
